title: How to Make Your PS3 Faster

steps.title: Power off your PS3.
steps.content: Power off your PS3.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button on the PS3 until it turns on, then turns off.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button on the PS3 until it turns on, then turns off.

steps.title: Press and hold the power button, then release after hearing a total of four beeps:
steps.content: Press and hold the power button, then release after hearing a total of four beeps: two slow beeps, followed by two quick beeps. Your PS3 will power on and display the Recovery Menu. Repeat this step if the PS3 powers off again. This means you released the power button too late.

steps.title: Scroll to and select “Rebuild Database.
steps.content: Scroll to and select “Rebuild Database. ” This option deletes messages, playlists, video playback history, and other personal settings on your PS3. Rebuilding the database speeds up the performance of your PS3 without deleting your games, photos, videos, music, trophies, and files.

steps.title: Select “Yes” to confirm you want to continue.
steps.content: Select “Yes” to confirm you want to continue. Your PS3 will rebuild its database, then reboot when finished.

steps.title: Switch to using a wired Ethernet connection, if possible.
steps.content: Switch to using a wired Ethernet connection, if possible. A wired connection is often faster, more reliable, and more consistent with Internet speeds than wireless connections.

steps.title: Power on your computer and connect to the same network as your PS3.
steps.content: Power on your computer and connect to the same network as your PS3.

steps.title: Launch the command console on your computer.
steps.content: Launch the command console on your computer. For example, if using a Windows PC, press ⊞ Win + R to open the Run dialog box.

steps.title: Type “ipconfig” and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type “ipconfig” and press ↵ Enter . This displays details about your network.

steps.title: Write down all details about your network.
steps.content: Write down all details about your network. You’ll be entering these values into your PS3 later on. This includes the IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway.

steps.title: Power on your PS3 and select “Settings.
steps.content: Power on your PS3 and select “Settings. ”

steps.title: Select “Network Settings,” then select “Internet Connection Settings.
steps.content: Select “Network Settings,” then select “Internet Connection Settings. ”

steps.title: Select “Custom,” then choose your Internet connection type.
steps.content: Select “Custom,” then choose your Internet connection type. If using a wireless connection, enter your network name and password.

steps.title: Scroll down to “IP address.
steps.content: Scroll down to “IP address. ”

steps.title: Enter your network’s IP address, using different values for the last three digits.
steps.content: Enter your network’s IP address, using different values for the last three digits. The last three digits can be any value between zero and 255. For example, if your IP address is 192.789.1.53, try changing your PS3’s IP address to 192.789.1.60. This prevents multiple devices on your network from sharing the same IP. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your network’s subnet mask and default gateway values.
steps.content: Enter your network’s subnet mask and default gateway values.

steps.title: Enter your network’s primary and secondary DNS values.
steps.content: Enter your network’s primary and secondary DNS values. If your Internet service provider doesn’t have this information, enter the following values: Primary: 8.8.8.8 Secondary : 8.8.4.4

steps.title: Select “Test Connection.
steps.content: Select “Test Connection. ” This confirms your PS3 is successfully connected to your network using the new IP. This helps your PS3 run faster and more efficiently.

steps.title: Dust and clean your PS3
steps.content: Dust and clean your PS3 regularly to maintain its performance and prevent slowness. Dust buildup causes your system to lag and run more slowly.

steps.title: Delete the “Predictive Text Dictionary” data in your PS3.
steps.content: Delete the “Predictive Text Dictionary” data in your PS3. This deletes data that was saved when entering Internet search terms. Navigate to Settings > System Settings > Predictive Text Dictionary.

steps.title: Delete the cookies and cache from your Internet browser.
steps.content: Delete the cookies and cache from your Internet browser. This frees up extra memory on your PS3 console. Navigate to Network > Internet Browser, then press the △ button on your controller. Navigate to Options > Tools > Delete Cookies or Delete Cache. Select “Yes” to confirm you want cookies and cache deleted.

steps.title: Disable the “Display What’s New” feature.
steps.content: Disable the “Display What’s New” feature. This prevents the Internet from downloading the latest information for this feature when logging in. Navigate to Settings > System Settings > Display What’s New.

steps.title: Perform a hard reset on your PS3.
steps.content: Perform a hard reset on your PS3. A hard reset formats your system and restores the PS3 to its original factory settings. Manually power off your PS3 using the switch at the back of the console. Press and hold the power button in front, then release when you hear three beeps. Follow the on-screen instructions to set up your PS3 like new.
